tourmalines.name: Tourmaline
tourmalines.alt: A stone cut open and polished, revealing a bright rainbow of colors
tourmalines.color: Most commonly black, but can range from colorless to brown, red, orange, yellow, green, blue, violet, pink, or hues in between; can be bi-colored, or even tri-colored; rarely can be neon green or electric blue
tourmalines.habit: Parallel and elongated. Acicular prisms, sometimes radiating. Massive. Scattered grains (in granite).
tourmalines.birefringence: -0.018 to −0.040; typically about .020 but in dark stones it may reach .040
tourmalines.pleochroism:
{{plainlist|
*Typically moderate to strong|ref| name="GRG" |
*Red: definite; dark red, light red
*Green: strong; dark green, yellow-green
*Brown: definite; dark brown, light brown
*Blue: strong; dark blue, light blue}} *Red: definite; dark red, light red
*Green: strong; dark green, yellow-green
*Brown: definite; dark brown, light brown
*Blue: strong; dark blue, light blue
tourmalines.fluorescence: pink stones—inert to very weak red to violet in long and short wave
tourmalines.absorption: Strong narrow band at 498 nm, and almost complete absorption of red down to 640 nm in blue and green stones; red and pink stones show lines at 458 and 451 nm as well as a broad band in the green spectrum

anhydrite.name: Anhydrite

anhydrite.twinning: Simple or repeatedly on {011} common; contact twins rare on {120}
anhydrite.cleavage:
[010] perfect
[100] perfect
[001] good, resulting in pseudocubic fragments
anhydrite.luster:
Pearly on {010}
vitreous to greasy on {001}
vitreous on {100}
anhydrite.pleochroism:
For violet varieties
''X'' = colorless to pale yellow or rose
''Y'' = pale violet or rose
''Z'' = violet.
anhydrite.other: Some specimens fluoresce; many more fluoresce after heating

crookesite.name: Crookesite

cryolite.name: Cryolite
cryolite.caption: Cryolite from Ivigtut Greenland
cryolite.color: Colorless to white, also brownish, reddish and rarely black
cryolite.habit: Usually massive, coarsely granular.  The rare crystals are equant and pseudocubic
cryolite.twinning: Very common, often repeated or polysynthetic with simultaneous occurrence of several twin laws
cryolite.solubility: Soluble in AlCl<sub>3</sub> solution, soluble in H<sub>2</sub>SO<sub>4</sub> with the evolution of HF, which is poisonous. Insoluble in water.
cryolite.other: Weakly thermoluminescent.  Small clear fragments become nearly invisible when placed in water, since its refractive index is close to that of water.  May fluoresce intense yellow under SWUV, with yellow phosphorescence, and pale yellow phosphorescence under LWUV.  Not radioactive.
described by source (p1343): Norwegische titanerze und andre neue fossilien (Q30129098)

ammonium hexafluorosilicate.othernames:
Ammonium fluorosilicate
Ammonium fluosilicate
Ammonium silicofluoride

cryptomelane.name: Cryptomelane
cryptomelane.color: Steel-gray to bluish gray; light tan or gray in reflected light
cryptomelane.habit: Rare as subhedral crystals, commonly as compact fine-grained masses, banded colloform, botryoidal, or radial fibrous aggregates
cryptomelane.twinning: Twinning developed on (010) and (101) resulting in a pseudotetragonal unit cell.
cryptomelane.described by source (p1343): Cryptomelane, a new name for the commonest of the "psilomelane" minerals (Q30094011)

gyrolite.name: Gyrolite
gyrolite.caption: Gyrolite
gyrolite.color: White, colorless, green, yellow or brown
gyrolite.description: Rare phyllosilicate mineral crystallizing in spherules

cubanite.name: Cubanite
cubanite.caption: Striated, cyclically-twinned cubanite crystals from the Chibougamau mines of Quebec. (size: 1.5 x 1.3 x 1.0 cm)
cubanite.habit: Crystals elongated to thick tabular, striated also massive
cubanite.twinning: Common with twin plane {110} in pairs, also as fourlings and pseudohexagonal sixlings

cumengeite.described by source (p1343): Sur la boléite, la cumengéite et la percylite (Q63860570)

cummingtonite.name: Cummingtonite
cummingtonite.image: Amphibole - Cummingtonite w- chlorite in schist Magnesium iron silicate 3800 foot level Homestake Mine Lawrence COunty South Dakota 2071.jpg
cummingtonite.color: Dark green, brown, gray, beige; colorless to pale green in thin section
cummingtonite.habit: Rarely as distinct crystals. Columnar to fibrous and granular
cummingtonite.pleochroism: With increasing iron content, weak; X = Y = colorless; Z = pale green
cummingtonite.diagnostic: Characterized by light brown color and needlelike, often radiating habit. Difficult to distinguish from anthophyllite or gedrite without optical and/or X-ray tests.
cummingtonite.diaphaneity: Translucent, will transmit light on thin edges.
cummingtonite.description: Mineral discovered and named after its place of discovery, Cummington, Massachusetts
cummingtonite.image (p18): Amphibole - Cummingtonite w- chlorite in schist Magnesium iron silicate 3800 foot level Homestake Mine Lawrence COunty South Dakota 2071.jpg
cummingtonite.described by source (p1343): A sketch of the geology and mineralogy of the western part of Massachusetts, and a small part of the adjoining states (Q41928337)

cuprite.name: Cuprite
cuprite.caption: Cuprite from [[Morenci, Arizona]]
cuprite.color: Dark red to conchineal red, sometimes almost black
cuprite.habit: Cubic, octahedral, and dodecahedral crystals; as hairlike capillary forms, earthy, compact granular and massive
cuprite.cleavage: Fair in four directions forming octahedrons

cuprosklodowskite.habit: In radiating groups of [[Acicular (crystal habit)|acicular]] flattened or bladed needles or fibrous crusts
cuprosklodowskite.pleochroism: X = nearly colorless; Y = Z = yellowish green

cuprospinel.name: Cuprospinel
cuprospinel.habit: Irregular grains, laminae intergrown with hematite

curite.name: Curite
curite.caption: Curite
curite.pleochroism: Visible: X = b = pale yellow, Y = a = light red-orange, Z = c = dark red-orange

diamond.name: Diamond

diamond.description: Allotrope of carbon often used as a gemstone and an abrasive

diopside.twinning: Simple and multiple twins common on {100} and {001}

dioptase.habit: Six sided prisms terminated by rhombohedrons to massive

May fluoresce white to pink under UV; triboluminescent.
[[Solubility equilibrium#Dissolution with dissociation|Ksp]] values vary between 1x10−19 to 1x10−17
